sen.j: 御土居（おどい）は豊臣秀吉によって作られた京都を囲む土塁である。
sen.e: Odoi is a mound built by Hideyoshi TYOTOMI surrounding Kyoto.
Odoi is a mound built by Hideyoshi TYOTOMI surrounding Kyoto.
Odoi is a mound built by Hideyoshi TYOTOMI surrounding Kyoto.

sen.j: 外側の堀とあわせて御土居堀とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: This mound together with the moat on its outside is also called Odoi-hori Moat.
This mound together with the moat on its outside is also called Odoi-hori Moat.
This mound together with the moat on its outside is also called Odoi-hori Moat.

sen.j: 聚楽第、寺町通、天正の地割とともに秀吉による京都改造事業の一つである。
sen.e: This is a product of Hideyoshi's project of reconstructing Kyoto along with Jurakudai Castle, Teramachi-dori Street, and Tensho no Jiwari (land allotment system in the Tensho period).
This is a product of Hideyoshi's project of reconstructing Kyoto along with Jurakudai Castle, Teramachi-dori Street, and Tensho no Jiwari (land allotment system during the Tensho period).
This is a product of Hideyoshi's project of reconstructing Kyoto along with Jurakudai Castle, Teramachi-dori Street, and Tensho no Jiwari (land allotment system during the Tensho period).

sen.j: 一部が京都市内に現存し、史跡に指定されている。
sen.e: A remaining part of this mound in Kyoto City is designated as a Historic Spot.
A part of this mound still remaining in Kyoto City is designated as a Historic Spot.
A part of this mound still remaining in Kyoto City is designated as a Historic Spot.

sen.j: 位置
sen.e: Location
Location
Location

sen.j: 秀吉時代の御土居の位置に関する記録は現存しないが、現存する遺構や江戸時代の絵図からその位置が推定されている。
sen.e: The position of Odoi mound is estimated based on its existing remains and maps of the Edo period, because records on its position of the time of Hideyoshi are lost now.
The position of the Odoi mound is estimated based on its existing remains and maps of the Edo period, because the actual records of its position from the time of Hideyoshi are now lost.
The position of the Odoi mound is estimated based on its existing remains and maps of the Edo period, because the actual records of its position from the time of Hideyoshi are now lost.

sen.j: 御土居の囲む範囲は南北約8.5km、東西約3.5kmの縦長の形をしている。
sen.e: It encircles a rectangular area that measures about 8.5 km from north to south and about 3.5 km from east to west.
It encircles a rectangular area that measures about 8.5 km from north to south and about 3.5 km from east to west.
It encircles a rectangular area that measures about 8.5 km from north to south and about 3.5 km from east to west.
sen.cmt: 余分な改行をのぞきました。

sen.j: 御土居は必ずしも直線状ではなく、特に西側では数箇所の凹凸がある。
sen.e: Odoi mound is not necessarily linearly arranged, with a few indentations on the west side.
Odoi mound is not necessarily linearly arranged, it has a few indentations on the west side.
Odoi mound is not necessarily linearly arranged, it has a few indentations on the west side.

sen.j: 全長は約22.5kmである。
sen.e: It is about 22.5 km in entire length.
It's entire length is about 22.5 km.
It's entire length is about 22.5 km.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースをのぞきました。

sen.j: 北端は北区紫竹の加茂川中学校付近、南端は南区の東寺の南、東端はほぼ現在の河原町通、西端は中京区の山陰本線円町駅付近にあたる。
sen.e: Its northern end is around Kamogawa Junior High School at Shichiku of Kita Ward; its southern end is at the south of To-ji Temple in Minami Ward; its eastern end roughly comes into line with present Kawaramachi-dori Street; and its western end is around Enmachi Station of Sanin Main Line in Nakagyo Ward.

Its northern end is around Kamogawa Junior High School at Shichiku of Kita Ward; its southern end is at the south of To-ji Temple in Minami Ward; its eastern end roughly comes into line with present Kawaramachi-dori Street; and its western end is around Enmachi Station of Sanin Main Line in Nakagyo Ward.

Its northern end is around Kamogawa Junior High School at Shichiku of Kita-ku Ward; its southern end is at the south of To-ji Temple in Minami-ku Ward; its eastern end roughly comes into line with present Kawaramachi-dori Street; and its western end is around Enmachi Station of Sanin Main Line in Nakagyo-ku Ward.

sen.j: また東部では鴨川（賀茂川）に、北西部では紙屋川（天神川）に沿っており、これらが堀を兼ねていた。
sen.e: Its eastern part lied along Kamo-gawa River, its northwestern part lied along Kamiya-gawa River (Tenjin-gawa River), and these rivers served as moats.
Its eastern part was along Kamo-gawa River, its northwestern part was along Kamiya-gawa River (Tenjin-gawa River), and these rivers served as moats.
Its eastern part was along the Kamo-gawa River, its northwestern part was along the Kamiya-gawa River (also known as the Tenjin-gawa River), and these rivers served as moats.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 御土居の内部を洛中、外部を洛外と呼んだ。
sen.e: The area inside Odoi mound was called Rakuchu, and outside, Rakugai.
The area inside Odoi mound was called Rakuchu, and outside, Rakugai.
The area inside Odoi mound was called Rakuchu, and outside, Rakugai.

sen.j: ただし、御土居の内部であっても鞍馬口通以北は洛外と呼ばれることもあった。
sen.e: The area north to Kuramagushi-dori Street inside Odoi was sometimes called Rakugai.
The area north to Kuramagushi-dori Street inside Odoi was sometimes called Rakugai.
The area north to Kuramaguchi-dori Street inside Odoi was sometimes called Rakugai.

sen.j: 洛中とを洛外を結ぶ道が御土居を横切る場所を「口」と呼んだ。
sen.e: Those spots at which Odoi was cut by roads that connected Rakuchu and Rakugai were called 'Kuchi (Guchi).'
Those spots at which Odoi was cut by roads that connected Rakuchu and Rakugai were called 'Kuchi (Guchi).'
Those spots at which Odoi was cut by roads that connected Rakuchu and Rakugai were called 'Kuchi' (Guchi).

sen.j: 現在でも鞍馬口、丹波口などの地名が残っている。
sen.e: Place names such as Kuramaguchi and Tanbaguchi survive today.
Place names such as Kuramaguchi and Tanbaguchi survive today.
Place names such as Kuramaguchi and Tanbaguchi survive today.

sen.j: 『三藐院記』（近衛信尹の日記）によると御土居建造当時の口は10箇所であった。
sen.e: There were ten Kuchi when it was built according to "Sanmyakuinki Diary" (diary of Nobutaka KONOE).
There were ten Kuchi when it was built according to "Sanmyakuinki Diary" (diary of Nobutaka KONOE).
There were ten Kuchi when it was built according to "Sanmyakuinki" (diary of Nobutaka KONOE).

sen.j: 構造
sen.e: Structure
Structure
Structure

sen.j: 1920年（大正9年）に京都府が行なった実測調査によると、御土居の断面は基底部が約20m、頂部が約5m、高さ約5mの台形状であった。
sen.e: Kyoto Prefecture's survey in 1920 revealed that the cross section of Odoi mound was a trapezoid measuring about twenty meters wide at the base, about five meters wide at the top, and about five meters tall.

Kyoto Prefecture's survey in 1920 revealed that the cross section of Odoi mound was a trapezoid measuring about twenty meters wide at the base, about five meters wide at the top, and about five meters tall.

Kyoto Prefecture's survey in 1920 revealed that the cross section of Odoi mound was a trapezoid measuring about twenty meters wide at the base, about five meters wide at the top, and about five meters tall.

sen.j: 土塁の外側に沿って堀があり、その幅は10数m、深さは最大約4m程度であった。
sen.e: Along the outer side of the mound was built a moat measuring about a dozen meters wide and about four meters deep at the maximum.
Along the outer side of the mound a moat was built measuring about a dozen meters wide and about four meters deep at the maximum.
Along the outer side of the mound a moat was built measuring about a dozen meters wide and about four meters deep at the maximum.

sen.j: 御土居の上には竹が植えられていた。
sen.e: Bamboo trees were planted on top of Odoi mound.
Bamboo trees were planted on top of Odoi mound.
Bamboo trees were planted on top of Odoi mound.

sen.j: また御土居の内部から石仏が出土することがあるが、その理由は不明である。
sen.e: Stone Buddhist images are sometimes excavated from inside the mound, and the reason why they were buried there is unknown.
Stone Buddhist images are sometimes excavated from inside the mound, and the reason why they were buried there is unknown.
Stone Buddhist images are sometimes excavated from inside the mound, and the reason why they were buried there is unknown.

sen.j: 建造の目的
sen.e: Purpose of its construction
Purpose of its construction
Purpose of its Construction

sen.j: 秀吉自身が御土居建設の目的を説明した文献は現存しないが、以下のような理由が推測されている。
sen.e: Although there are no documents that refer to the purposes of its construction explained by Hideyoshi's own words, the following theories are presented:
Although there are no documents that refer to the purposes of its construction explained by Hideyoshi's own words, the following theories are presented:
Although there are no documents that refer to the purposes of its construction explained by Hideyoshi's own words, the following theories are presented:

sen.j: 防衛
sen.e: Military defense
Military defense
Military Defense

sen.j: 戦国時代後期の都市の多くには惣構と呼ばれる都市全体を囲む防壁があった。
sen.e: Many cities in the Sengoku period had encircling protective walls called 'Sogamae' (惣構) (literally, 'defense all around').
Many cities in the Sengoku period had encircling protective walls called 'Sogamae' (惣構) (literally, 'defense all around').
Many cities in the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) had encircling protective walls called 'Sogamae' (defense facilities such as moat and mound).
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 当時の京都は応仁の乱後の荒廃により上京と下京の2つの町に分裂し、それぞれに惣構があった。
sen.e: Devastated by Onin-no-ran Battle, Kyoto at that time was split into two towns, Kamigyo and Shimogyo, and each had Sogamae.
Devastated by Onin-no-ran Battle, Kyoto at that time was split into two towns, Kamigyo and Shimogyo, and each had Sogamae.
Devastated by the Onin War, Kyoto at that time was split into two towns, Kamigyo and Shimogyo, and each had Sogamae.
sen.cmt: 指示書に合わせました。

sen.j: 秀吉は京都の町を拡大するためこれらの惣構を取り壊し、それに代わる大規模な惣構として御土居を建設したと考えられている。
sen.e: Hideyoshi is thought to have built Odoi mound as a large scale Sogamae to replace the old Sogamae by dismantling them with the aim of expanding the city area of Kyoto.
Hideyoshi is thought to have built the Odoi mound as a large scale Sogamae to replace the old Sogamae by dismantling them with the aim of expanding the city area of Kyoto.
Hideyoshi is thought to have built the Odoi mound as a large scale Sogamae to replace the old Sogamae by dismantling them with the aim of expanding the city area of Kyoto.

sen.j: ただし、防衛のみを目的としたにしては以下に述べるような不自然な点がある。
sen.e: However, it has some unreasonable aspects for the purpose of military defense as follows:
However, there are some unreasonable aspects for the purpose of military defense as follows:
However, there are some unreasonable aspects for the purpose of military defense as follows:

sen.j: 御土居の囲む範囲は当時の市街地に比べ極めて広く、西部や北部においては第2次世界大戦後まで農地が広がっていた場所すらある。
sen.e: The area surrounded by Odoi was extremely large compared to the urban area at that time, and some areas at the west and at the north were farmlands until the end of the Second World War.
The area surrounded by Odoi was extremely large compared to the urban area at that time, and some areas at the west and at the north were farmlands until the end of the Second World War.
The area surrounded by Odoi was extremely large compared to the urban area at that time, and some areas at the west and at the north were farmlands until the end of the Second World War.

sen.j: このため御土居の全長は長くなり、防衛に必要な兵力が多くなる。
sen.e: This made the length of Odoi mound very long and required a large number of defense soldiers.
This made the length of Odoi mound very long and required a large number of soldiers to defend it.
This made the length of Odoi mound very long and required a large number of soldiers to defend it.
sen.cmt: 不要な改行をのぞきました。

sen.j: 御土居の上に竹が植えられていたため視界が遮られ、また兵士が御土居の上を移動することが難しい。
sen.e: Bamboo trees on Odoi blocked the view and made it difficult for soldiers to move on the mound.
Bamboo trees on Odoi blocked the view and made it difficult for soldiers to move on the mound.
Bamboo trees on Odoi blocked the view and made it difficult for soldiers to move on the mound.

sen.j: 通常防壁上に作られるような櫓などもない。
sen.e: It had no Yagura (turret) which was usually built on a protective wall.
It had no Yagura (turret) which was usually built on a protective wall.
It had no Yagura (turret) which was usually built on a protective wall.

sen.j: 絵図によれば、御土居の出入口には何の障害物もなく、当時の城郭で用いられたような侵入者を防ぐ構造が見られない。
sen.e: A picture map of Odoi shows no obstructions at any entrances of Odoi and no structures to repel intruders which were usually used for castles at that time.
A picture map of Odoi shows no obstructions at any entrances of Odoi and no structures to repel intruders which were usually used for castles at that time.
A picture map of Odoi shows no obstructions at any entrances of Odoi and no structures to repel intruders which were usually used for castles at that time.

sen.j: 堤防
sen.e: Dike
Dike
Dike

sen.j: 御土居の東側は鴨川の西に沿っており、その堤防としての役割を持っていた。
sen.e: The east side of Odoi faced the west side of Kamo-gawa River playing a role of a dike of the river.
The east side of Odoi faced the west side of the Kamo-gawa River playing a role of a dike of the river.
The east side of Odoi faced the west side of the Kamo-gawa River playing a role of a dike of the river.

sen.j: 御土居が北へ長く延びているのは、この地域で鴨川が氾濫すると京都市街地へ水が流入してしまうためである。
sen.e: Odoi mound extends to the north to protect the Kyoto's urban area from flood water of this part of Kamo-gawa River.
The Odoi mound extends to the north to protect the Kyoto's urban area from flood water at this part of Kamo-gawa River.
The Odoi mound extends to the north to protect the Kyoto's urban area from flood water at this part of the Kamo-gawa River.

sen.j: その他の目的
sen.e: Other purposes
Other purposes
Other Purposes

sen.j: 寺社勢力との分断
sen.e: It was to fend off the influences of temples and shrines.
It was to fend off the influences of temples and shrines.
It was to fend off the influences of temples and shrines.

sen.j: 中世の京都では延暦寺、八坂神社など周辺の寺社が大きな影響力を持っていた。
sen.e: Temples and shrines such as Enryaku-ji Temple and Yasaka-jinja Shrine in the neighborhood had significantly influential powers in the medieval Kyoto.
Temples and shrines such as Enryaku-ji Temple and Yasaka-jinja Shrine in the neighborhood had significantly influential powers in the medieval Kyoto.
Temples and shrines such as Enryaku-ji Temple and Yasaka-jinja Shrine in the neighborhood had significantly influential powers in the medieval Kyoto.

sen.j: 御土居によって洛中と洛外の交通を制限することにより、これらの勢力を削ろうとした、とする説がある。
sen.e: Some say that Odoi was to stem these powers by restricting the traffic between Rakuchu and Rakugai.
Some say that Odoi was to stem these powers by restricting the traffic between Rakuchu and Rakugai.
Some say that Odoi was to stem these powers by restricting the traffic between Rakuchu and Rakugai.

sen.j: 美観
sen.e: Aesthetic purposes
Aesthetic purposes
Aesthetic Purposes

sen.j: ルイス・フロイスの『日本史』によると、秀吉が御土居に樹木（竹）を植えさせたのは美観のためであった。
sen.e: According to "Nihonshi (History of Japan)" by Luis FROIS, Hideyoshi had Odoi planted with trees (bamboo) for aesthetic purposes.
According to "Nihonshi (History of Japan)" by Luis FROIS, Hideyoshi had Odoi planted with trees (bamboo) for aesthetic purposes.
According to "Nihonshi" (History of Japan) by Luis FROIS, Hideyoshi had Odoi planted with trees (bamboo) for aesthetic purposes.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 建造
sen.e: Construction
Construction
Construction

sen.j: 御土居の建造が始まったのは1591年（天正19年）の1月から閏1月（太陰暦）ごろである。
sen.e: Construction of Odoi mound started in the first month or in the leap first month (in the lunar calendar) of 1591.
Construction of the Odoi mound started in the first month or in the leap first month (in the lunar calendar) of 1591.
Construction of the Odoi mound started around January and February 1591.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦にしました。

sen.j: 同年の3月ごろにはほぼ完成していた、との記録がある。
sen.e: A record says that it was almost completed in the third month of the same year.
Records say that it was almost completed in the third month of the same year.
Records say that it was almost completed in April of the same year.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦にしました。

sen.j: 当時の京都では聚楽第、寺町など多くの工事が並行して行なわれていた。
sen.e: Many other constructions such as of Jurakudai Palace and Teramachi (the temples district) were under way at the same time in Kyoto at that time.
Many other constructions such as of Jurakudai Palace and Teramachi (the temples district) were under way at the same time in Kyoto.
Many other constructions such as of Jurakudai Palace and Teramachi (the temples district) were under way at the same time in Kyoto.

sen.j: 江戸時代
sen.e: The Edo period
The Edo period
The Edo Period

sen.j: 豊臣政権が崩壊すると、道路を分断していた部分の御土居が取り壊され多くの出入口が設けられた。
sen.e: Following the demise of Toyotomi regime, pieces of Odoi mound across roads were dismantled and many passages were cut open.
Following the demise of Toyotomi regime, parts of the Odoi mound across roads were dismantled and many passages were cut open.
Following the demise of Toyotomi regime, parts of the Odoi mound across roads were dismantled and many passages were cut open.

sen.j: たとえば現在の四条河原町付近で四条通を塞いでいた部分は1601年（慶長6年）に撤去されている。
sen.e: The mound that had blocked Shijo-dori Street close to the place of present Shijo Kawaramachi was removed in 1601.
The mound that had blocked Shijo-dori Street close to the place of present Shijo Kawaramachi was removed in 1601.
The mound that had blocked Shijo-dori Street close to the place of present Shijo Kawaramachi was removed in 1601.

sen.j: また市街地東部では、木屋町通、先斗町など御土居の東側の鴨川河原まで町が広がり、1670年（寛文10年）に寛文新堤が完成して堤防としての必要もなくなったため、御土居は寺社や公家に払い下げられ、取り壊されて住宅地などになった。
sen.e: At the east of the urban area, such as Kiyamachi-dori Street and Ponto Cho expanded close to the riverside of Kamo-gawa River outside the east of Odoi mound, and Kanbun Shintei Dike was completed in 1670 to make Odoi useless as a dike, so the mounds were sold to temples, shrines, and court nobles, and eventually was dismantled to be residential lands.

At the east side of the urban area, such as Kiyamachi-dori Street and Ponto Cho expanded close to the riverside of Kamo-gawa River outside the east of Odoi mound, and Kanbun Shintei Dike was completed in 1670 to make Odoi useless as a dike, so the mounds were sold to temples, shrines, and court nobles, and eventually were dismantled to become residential lands.

At the east side of the urban area, such as Kiyamachi-dori Street and Ponto-cho expanded close to the riverside of the Kamo-gawa River outside the east of Odoi mound, and Kanbun Shintei Dike was completed in 1670 to make Odoi useless as a dike, so the mounds were sold to temples, shrines, and court nobles, and eventually were dismantled to become residential lands.

sen.j: ただし、これらを除く部分の御土居は多くが残り、江戸幕府によって竹林として管理されていた。
sen.e: However, most of other pieces of the mound than mentioned above remained, and the Edo Bakufu (Shogunate) government took care of them as bamboo woods.
However, most of the other parts of the mound than those mentioned above remain, and the Edo Bakufu (Shogunate) government took care of them as bamboo woods.
However, most of the other parts of the mound than those mentioned above remain, and the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) government took care of them as bamboo woods.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 江戸時代中期には角倉家が管理を担当していた。
sen.e: The Suminokura family was in charge of the management of Odoi in the middle of the Edo period.
The Suminokura family was in charge of the management of Odoi during the middle of the Edo period.
The Suminokura family was in charge of the management of Odoi during the middle of the Edo period.

sen.j: 御土居は取り壊されるだけとは限らず、移築されることもあった。
sen.e: Odoi mound was not only dismantled but some pieces of it were moved to other places.
The Odoi mound was not only dismantled, but some pieces of it were moved to other places.
The Odoi mound was not only dismantled, but some pieces of it were moved to other places.

sen.j: 1641年（寛永18年）に始まる東本願寺の新たな寺内町の開発に伴い、御土居は高瀬川とともに東側に移された。
sen.e: The redevelopment of Jinai-cho (temple villages) of Higashihongan-ji Temple started in 1641, and it moved part of Odoi and Takase-gawa River to the east.
The redevelopment of Jinai-cho (temple villages) of Higashihongan-ji Temple started in 1641, and it moved part of Odoi and Takase-gawa River to the east.
The redevelopment of Jinai-cho (temple villages) of Higashi Hongan-ji Temple started in 1641, and it moved part of Odoi and the Takase-gawa River to the east.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 枳殻邸（渉成園）の築山は移築前の御土居の土塁を再利用したと言われている。
sen.e: Tsukiyama (a miniature hill) in Kikokutei (Shosei-en Garden) is said to have used the soil of Odoi.
Tsukiyama (a miniature hill) in Kikokutei (Shosei-en Garden) is said to have used the soil of Odoi.
Tsukiyama (a miniature hill) in Kikokutei (Shosei-en Garden) is said to have used the soil of Odoi.

sen.j: 明治以降
sen.e: The Meiji period and thereafter
The Meiji period and thereafter
The Meiji Period and Thereafter

sen.j: 明治に入ると、それまで幕府の所有していた部分も民間の所有となり、土塁上の竹を伐採して畑などに転用された。
sen.e: In the Meiji period, Odoi changed is hands from the Bakufu to people, and the mounds were turned into fields with their bamboo trees being cut down.
During the Meiji period, Odoi changed hands from the Bakufu to the people, and the mounds were turned into fields with their bamboo trees being cut down.
During the Meiji period, Odoi changed hands from the bakufu to the people, and the mounds were turned into fields with their bamboo trees being cut down.

sen.j: この時点では土塁自体は取り壊されていなかったが、大正期には市街地の拡大により住宅開発などのため、多くの場所で御土居が壊された。
sen.e: Although most of the mounds remained in the Meiji period, in the Taisho period, many pieces of Odoi were dismantled in order to develop residential lands because the urban area grew larger.
Although most of the mounds remained during the Meiji period, in the Taisho period, many parts of Odoi were dismantled in order to develop residential lands because the urban area grew larger.
Although most of the mounds remained during the Meiji period, in the Taisho period, many parts of Odoi were dismantled in order to develop residential lands because the urban area grew larger.

sen.j: こうした中、残る御土居を保護するため、1930年（昭和5年）に8箇所が国の史跡に指定された。
sen.e: Responding to this situation, to preserve remaining Odoi, the government designated eight sites of it as National Historic Spots in 1930.
Responding to this situation, to preserve the remaining parts of Odoi, the government designated eight sites as National Historic Spots in 1930.
Responding to this situation, to preserve the remaining parts of Odoi, the government designated eight sites as National Historic Spots in 1930.

sen.j: また1965年（昭和40年）に1箇所が追加指定されている。
sen.e: An additional spot was designated one in 1965.
An additional spot was designated in 1965.
An additional spot was designated in 1965.

sen.j: 史跡指定地以外ではその後も撤去が進み、1960年代には史跡指定地の御土居が宅地造成業者によって破壊される事件が何度か起こった。
sen.e: Those mounds other than the historic spots were continued to be removed, and there were some incidents in which housing developers damaged Odoi mounds that are designated historic spots in the 1960s.

Mounds other than the designated historic spots were continued to be removed, and there were some incidents in which housing developers damaged Odoi mounds that were designated as historic spots in the 1960s.

Mounds other than the designated historic spots were continued to be removed, and there were some incidents in which housing developers damaged Odoi mounds that were designated as historic spots in the 1960s.

Relics

sen.j: 1930年（昭和5年）史跡指定
sen.e: Designated as Historic Spots in 1930

sen.j: 北区紫竹上長目町・堀川町（加茂川中学校敷地など）
sen.e: Shichiku Kaminagame Cho and Shichiku Kamihorikawa Cho, Kita Ward (the site of Kamogawa Junior High School)
Shichiku Kaminagame Cho and Shichiku Kamihorikawa Cho, Kita Ward (the site of Kamogawa Junior High School)
Shichikukami Nagame-cho and Shichikukami Horikawa-cho, Kita-ku Ward (the site of Kamogawa Junior High School, and so on)

sen.e: Omiya Doi Cho, Kita Ward
Omiya Doi Cho, Kita Ward

sen.e: Takagamine Kyu Doi Cho 2, Kita Ward
Takagamine Kyu Doi Cho 2, Kita Ward
2 Takagamine Kyudoi-cho, Kita-ku Ward

sen.j: 北区鷹峯旧土居町3番地（御土居史跡公園）

sen.e: Murasakino Nishi Doi Cho, Kita Ward
Murasakino Nishi Doi Cho, Kita Ward

sen.e: Hirano Toriimae Cho, Kita Ward
Hirano Toriimae Cho, Kita Ward

sen.j: 上京区北之辺町 （廬山寺）
sen.e: Kitanobe Cho, Kamigyo ward (Rozan-ji Temple)
Kitanobe Cho, Kamigyo ward (Rozan-ji Temple)
Kitanobe-cho, Kamigyo-ku Ward (Rozan-ji Temple)

sen.j: 中京区西ノ京原町 （御土居上に市五郎神社社殿）
sen.e: Nishinokyo Hara Machi, Nakagyo Ward (Ichigoro-jinja Shrine)
Nishinokyo Hara Machi, Nakagyo Ward (Ichigoro-jinja Shrine)

sen.j: 上京区馬喰町 （北野天満宮境内）
sen.e: Bakuro Cho, Kamigyo Ward (Kitano Tenman-gu Shrine)
Bakuro Cho, Kamigyo Ward (Kitano Tenman-gu Shrine)
Bakuro-cho, Kamigyo-ku Ward (in the precinct of Kitano Tenman-gu Shrine)

sen.j: これら指定地以外にも、北野中学校校庭（中京区西ノ京中保町）や大宮交通公園（北区大宮西脇台）などに御土居が残っている。
sen.e: Other than these designated sites, there remain pieces of Odoi at the schoolyard of Kitano Middle School (Nishinokyo Nakaho Cho, Nakagyo Ward) and Omiya Kotsu Koen (Omiya Traffic Park) (Omiya Nishiwakidai, Kita Ward).

Other than these designated sites, there remain pieces of Odoi at the schoolyard of Kitano Middle School (Nishinokyo Nakaho Cho, Nakagyo Ward) and Omiya Kotsu Koen (Omiya Traffic Park) (Omiya Nishiwakidai, Kita Ward).

Other than these designated sites, there remain pieces of Odoi at the schoolyard of Kitano Junior High School (Nishinokyo Nakaho-cho, Nakagyo-ku Ward) and Omiya Kotsu Koen (Omiya Traffic Park) (Omiya Nishiwakidai, Kita-ku Ward), and so on.

sen.j: 地名・道路・地割
sen.e: Place-names, streets, and land allotments
Place-names, streets, and land allotments
Place-names, Streets, and Land Allotments

sen.j: 北区大宮土居町、鷹峯旧土居町などは御土居の跡がそのままひとつの「町」となったため、細長い形をしている。
sen.e: Omiyadoi Cho of Kita Ward and Takamine old Doi Cho are elongated in shape because they just replaced Odoi to become towns.
Omiyadoi Cho of Kita Ward and Takamine old Doi Cho are elongated in shape because they just replaced Odoi to become towns.
Omiyadoi Cho of Kita Ward and Takamine Kyudoi-cho are elongated in shape because they just replaced Odoi to become towns.

sen.j: 中京区東土居ノ内町、土居ノ内町、西土居ノ内町などの地名、また下京区の土手町通、中京区の西土居通といった通り名も御土居に由来する。
sen.e: The following place-names came from Odoi: town names such as Higashi Doinouchi Cho, Doinouchi Cho, and Nishi Doinouchi Cho of Nakagyo Ward; and street names such as Dotemachi-dori Street of Shimogyo Ward and Nishidoi-dori Street of Nakagyo Ward.

The following place-names came from Odoi: town names such as Higashi Doinouchi Cho, Doinouchi Cho, and Nishi Doinouchi Cho of Nakagyo Ward; and street names such as Dotemachi-dori Street of Shimogyo Ward and Nishidoi-dori Street of Nakagyo Ward.

The following place-names came from Odoi: Town names such as Higashi Doinouchi-cho, Doinouchi-cho, and Nishi Doinouchi-cho of Nakagyo-ku Ward; and street names such as Dotemachi-dori Street of Shimogyo-ku Ward and Nishidoi-dori Street of Nakagyo-ku Ward.

sen.j: 南区にはバス停「御土居」があり、北区の「大宮交通公園」バス停はかつて「大宮御土居」といった。
sen.e: There is a bus stop 'Odoi' in Minami Ward, and 'Omiya Kotsu Koen' bus stop in Kita Ward used be called 'Omiya Odoi.'
There is a bus stop called 'Odoi' in Minami Ward, and the 'Omiya Kotsu Koen' bus stop in Kita Ward used be called 'Omiya Odoi.'
There is a bus stop called 'Odoi' in Minami-ku Ward, and the 'Omiya Kotsu Koen' bus stop in Kita-ku Ward used be called 'Omiya Odoi.'

sen.j: 中京区と右京区、上京区と北区の区境の一部は御土居の線と一致する。
sen.e: Parts of the border lines between Nakagyo Ward and Ukyo Ward, and between Kamigyo Ward and Kita Ward fall in line with Odoi lines.
Parts of the border lines between Nakagyo Ward and Ukyo Ward, and between Kamigyo Ward and Kita Ward fall in line with Odoi lines.
Parts of the border lines between Nakagyo-ku Ward and Ukyo-ku Ward, and between Kamigyo-ku Ward and Kita-ku Ward fall in line with Odoi lines.

sen.j: また御土居に沿った線が道路となって残っている例もある。
sen.e: Some roads run along Odoi mounds.
Some roads run along the Odoi mound.
Some roads run along the Odoi mound.

sen.j: 京都駅0番ホーム
sen.e: Kyoto Station Platform Zero
Kyoto Station Platform Zero
Kyoto Station Platform Zero

sen.j: JR京都駅の0番のりば（旧1番線）のホームは御土居の盛土を利用したものである、と書籍などで紹介されることがあるが、これは誤りである。
sen.e: There are wrong descriptions in some books, which say Kyoto Station Platform Zero (old Platform One) uses a mound of Odoi.
There are incorrect descriptions in some books, which say Kyoto Station Platform Zero (old Platform One) uses a mound of Odoi.
There are incorrect descriptions in some books, which say Kyoto Station Platform Zero (old Platform One) uses a mound of Odoi.

sen.j: このホームは1914年（大正3年）の2代目京都駅開業時に作られたものだが、それ以前の明治時代の地図でも御土居は描かれていない。
sen.e: This platform was built in 1914 when the second Kyoto Station started service, and maps of the Meiji period before that show no Odoi mounds there.
This platform was built in 1914 when the second Kyoto Station started service, and maps of the Meiji period before that show no Odoi mounds there.
This platform was built in 1914 when the second Kyoto Station started service, and maps of the Meiji period before that show no Odoi mounds there.

sen.j: また駅の位置にあった東塩小路村の記録によると、1877年（明治10年）の鉄道開通に先立ちこの地域の御土居は取り壊されたという。
sen.e: According to the record of Higashi Shiokoji Mura Village which used be at the place of the station, Odoi mounds in this neighborhood were dismantled before the railway was opened in 1877.

According to the record of Higashi Shiokoji Mura Village which used be where the station was standing, parts of the Odoi mound in this neighborhood were dismantled before the railway was opened in 1877.

According to the record of Higashi Shiokoji-mura Village which used be where the station was standing, parts of the Odoi mound in this neighborhood were dismantled before the railway was opened in 1877.

sen.j: なお、1993年（平成5年）に行なわれたホーム西端での発掘調査で、堀の跡と思われる泥土層が見つかっている。
sen.e: The excavation survey at the west end of the platform in 1993 revealed a clay layer which is thought to be remains of the moat.
The excavation survey at the west end of the platform in 1993 revealed a clay layer which is thought to be remains of the moat.
The excavation survey at the west end of the platform in 1993 revealed a clay layer which is thought to be remains of the moat.
